content:
ubjected to the test of strict scrutiny. He held that the Davis program did not
meet the high standards of strict scrutiny, but some other consideration of
race might, such as in the Harvard College admissions program, which used
race as a “goal” rather than as a “quota” (much like the University of Michi-
gan Law School admissions program in the Gruttercase below).
In contrast, Brennan argued for a new interpretation of the equal protec-
tion clause. On this new interpretation, strict scrutiny
